obligate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make someone have to do something, because it is the law, their duty, or the right thing to do
obligate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Tenants are obligated to pay their rent on time.
obligate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to make it necessary for someone to do something
obligate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: A new law will obligate all companies engaging in banking business to get approval from the finance ministry.
obligate.translation[1].definitions[1].d: if an authority obligates an amount of money for something, it officially says it will spend that amount on it
obligate.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The Pentagon has obligated $987.9 million to overhaul and improve the aircraft.
